meanings.definition: A prenuptial agreement is a contract entered into by two people before they marry that outlines how assets will be divided in the event of divorce.
meanings.sent1: They signed a prenup before getting married to decide how their things would be split if they ever got divorced.
meanings.sent2: The couple decided to draft a prenup to protect their individual assets in case of a separation.
meanings.sent3: The prenup was like a safety net for their belongings in case their love story took an unexpected turn.
meanings.sent4: The prenup stood as a shield guarding their possessions in the stormy seas of marriage.
meanings.sent5: The prenup was a clear map showing where each treasure chest of assets belonged in case of a breakup.

meanings.definition: To prenup is to create or agree to a prenuptial agreement.
meanings.sent1: They decided to prenup before the wedding to ensure a fair division of assets if they ever split up.
meanings.sent2: She asked him if he was willing to prenup before they tied the knot.
meanings.sent3: They joked about prenupping as if it was a secret handshake for married couples.
meanings.sent4: In their minds, prenupping was like building a sturdy fence around their future finances.
meanings.sent5: To prenup was to plan for the worst while hoping for the best in their marriage journey.
